name: FortiNDRCloud
description: This app allows the use of the information provided by the FortiNDR Cloud Service to perform containment and investigative actions on Splunk SOAR

api_key.name: api_key
api_key.description: API Token to connect to FortiNDR Cloud RESTful APIs

first_poll.description: First Poll (<number> <time unit>, e.g., 12 hours, 7 days)
first_poll.name: first_poll

muted.description: Set to true to include muted detections. Default to false
muted.name: muted

polling_delay.description: Polling delay in minute. This is required to allow time for the detections to be added before polling them
polling_delay.name: polling_delay

muted_rule.description: Set to true to include muted rules. Default to false
muted_rule.name: muted_rule

account_uuid.description: Account UUID to filter retrieved detections
account_uuid.name: account_uuid

muted_device.description: Set to true to include muted devices. Default to false
muted_device.name: muted_device

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity using supplied configuration
Retrieve latest Detections from the FortiNDR Cloud Service

start_time.description: First Poll (<number> <time unit>, e.g., 12 hours, 7 days)
start_time.name: start_time

actions.description: Get a list of all sensors

account_uuid.description: UUID of account to filter by

sensor_id.description: ID of the sensor to filter by

include.description: Include additional metadata such as status, interfaces, admin.sensor, admin.zeek, admin.suricata, and network_usage

enabled.description: Filter by true or false. If not provided, all the sensors are returned

actions.description: Get a list of all devices

start_date.description: Filter devices based on when they were seen

end_date.description: Filter devices based on when they were seen

cidr.description: Filter devices that are under a specific CIDR

sensor_id.description: Filter devices that were observed by a specific sensor

traffic_direction.description: Filter devices that have been noted to only have a certain directionality of traffic ("external" vs "internal")

output.description: Date when the device was first seen
If external traffic has been observed for this device
If internal traffic has been observed for this device
IP address of the device

actions.description: Get a list of all the PCAP tasks

output.description: Unique ID of the task
Date when the task actually started
Requested date for the task start
Email address of the user that updated the task
Unique ID of the user that created the task
Date when the task was created
Name of the task
Current status of the task
Email address of the user that created the task
Unique ID of the user that updated the task

example_values: src host x.x.x.x and dst port 10001
output.description: Berkeley Packet Filter for the task
Date when the task actually ended
ID code of the customer account
Requested date for the task to end
Sensors this task is running on
Description of the task
If this task has files (true/false)
Sensors this task is running on
Files captured for this task

account_uuid.description: Account where the task will be created

bpf.description: The Berkeley Packet Filter for capture filtering

requested_start_date.description: The date the task will become active. (2019-01-30T00:00:00.000Z)

requested_end_date.description: The date the task will become inactive. (2019-12-31T23:59:59.000Z)

sensor_ids.description: List of sensor IDs, separated by ',', on which this task will run (separate multiple accounts by comma)

output.description: Unique ID of the task
Description of the task
Name of the task
Sensors this task is running on
ID code of the customer account

example_values: src host x.x.x.x and dst port 10001
output.description: Berkeley Packet Filter for the task
Unique ID of the user that created the task
Unique ID of the user that updated the task
Email address of the user that created the task
Email address of the user that updated the task
Date when the task was created
Sensors this task is running on
Requested date for the task start
Requested date for the task to end
Date when the task actually started
Date when the task actually ended
Current status of the task
Files captured for this task
If this task has files (true/false)

actions.description: Get event telemetry data grouped by time

interval.description: Interval to group by: hour (default) or day

start_date.description: Start date/time to query for. The default is 1 day ago for interval=hour or 30 days ago for interval=day

end_date.description: End date/time to query for. The default is the current time

group_by.description: Optionally group results by: sensor_id, event_type

output.description: Timestamp of the grouped data
Number of events
Sensor name (if grouped by sensor_id)
Type of event (if grouped by event_type)
Account Code (if grouped by account_code)

actions.description: Get packetstats telemetry data grouped by time

interval.description: Aggregation interval. default by hour if not specified

start_date.description: Scopes the returned metrics to dates after the given start_date. If empty returns most current packet stats

end_date.description: Scopes the returned metrics to dates before the given end_date. If empty returns most current packet stats

sensor_id.description: Scopes the returned metrics to the interfaces of the specified sensor ID

group_by.description: Option to group by the following fields: interface_name, sensor_id, account_code

output.description: Account code the data was filtered by
Timestamp of the grouped data
Interface the packet data was recorded from
Received throughput (bits per second)
Received data size (bytes)
Number of received errors
Number of received packets
Sensor ID packet data was recorded from
Transmitted data size (bytes)
Number of transmitted errors
Number of transmitted packets

actions.description: Get network telemetry data grouped by time

interval.description: The interval to filter by (day, month_to_day)

latest_each_month.description: Filters out all but the latest day and month_to_date for each month

sort_order.description: Sorts by account code first, then timestamp. asc or desc. The default is desc

limit.description: The maximum number of records to return, default: 100, max: 1000

offset.description: The number of records to skip past. Default: 0

output.description: The account code for the network usage
The top percentile BPS value across sensors
Percentile of BPS records to calculate for percentile_bps
Time span the calculation was performed over (day, month_to_day)
The date the calculation was performed until

actions.description: Get summary information about an IP or domain

entity.description: Entity name to retrieve summary information for

entity_type.description: Type of the entity we are searching. Allowed values are: ip, domain or file

account_uuid.description: Account uuid to filter by. If absent, all the caller's allowed accounts will be queried

actions.description: Get passive DNS information about an IP or domain

entity.description: IP or Domain to get passive DNS data for

record_type.description: Limit results to the specified DNS query type(s). Supported types are: A, AAAA, CNAME, MX, NS. Case insensitive

source.description: Limit the results to the specified data source(s). Note that not all Sources populate all fields. Supported sources are: ICEBRG_DNS. Case insensitive

resolve_external.description: When true, the service will query non-ICEBRG data sources. false by default

start_date.description: The earliest date before which to exclude results. Day granularity, inclusive

end_date.description: The latest date after which to exclude results. Day granularity, inclusive

account_uuid.description: Limit results to the specified account UUID(s). Defaults to all accounts for which the user has permission

limit.description: Maximum number of records to be returned. Default 1000

actions.description: Get DHCP information about an IP address

entity.description: IP to get DHCP data for

start_date.description: The earliest date before which to exclude results. Day granularity, inclusive

end_date.description: The latest date after which to exclude results. Day granularity, inclusive

account_uuid.description: Limit results to the specified account UUID(s). Defaults to all accounts for which the user has permission

hash.description: File hash. Can be an MD5, SHA1, or SHA256 hash of the file

account_uuid.description: For those with access to multiple accounts, specify a single account to return results from

status.description: Filter by detection status: active, resolved

muted.description: List detections that a user muted: true / false

muted_device.description: List detections for muted devices: true / false

include.description: Include additional information in the response (i.e. 'rules,indicators' add the rules and the indicators to the response)

sort_by.description: Field to sort by (first_seen, last_seen, status, device_ip, indicator_count)

offset.description: The number of records to skip past

limit.description: The number of records to return, default: 100, max: 10000

created_start_date.description: Created start date to filter by (inclusive)

created_end_date.description: Created end date to filter by (exclusive)

created_or_shared_start_date.description: Created or shared start date to filter by (inclusive)

created_or_shared_end_date.description: Created or shared end date to filter by (exclusive)

active_start_date.description: Active start date to filter by (inclusive)

active_end_date.description: Active end date to filter by (exclusive)

actions.description: Get a list of detection rules

account_uuid.description: For those with access to multiple accounts, specify a single account to return results from

has_detections.description: Include rules that have unmuted, unresolved detections

severity.description: Filter by severity: high, moderate, low

confidence.description: Filter by confidence: high, moderate, low

sort_by.description: The field to sort by: created, updated, detections, severity, confidence, category, last_seen, detections_muted. Defaults to updated

offset.description: The number of records to skip past

limit.description: The number of records to return, default: 100, max: 1000

resolution.description: Resolution state. Options: true_positive_mitigated, true_positive_no_action, false_positive, unknown'

actions.description: Get a list of the events that matched on a specific rule

rule_uuid.description: Rule UUID to get events for

offset.description: The number of records to skip past

limit.description: The number of records to return, default: 100, max: 1000

actions.description: Get a list of the events associated with a specific detection

offset.description: The number of records to skip past

limit.description: The number of records to return, default: 100, max: 1000

account_uuid.description: Account where the rule will be created

query_signature.description: The IQL query for the rule

device_ip_fields.description: List, separated by ',', of the fields to check for impacted devices. Using 'DEFAULT' if not provided

indicator_fields.description: List, separated by ',' of the indicator's fields

run_account_uuids.description: Account UUIDs on which this rule will run. This will usually be just your own account UUID. (separate multiple accounts by comma)

auto_resolution_minutes.description: The number of minutes after which detections will be auto-resolved. If 0 then detections have to be manually resolved
